Title: A Taste of Animethon / A Taste of Animethon
Organizer: Alberta Society for Asian Popular Arts (ASAPA)
Summary: Animethon started back in 1994 by the Banzai Anime Klub of Alberta (BAKA), with the intent of promoting Japanese anime. It became a success by presenting well-known and more obscure anime to audiences, and has since grown to what it is now. Today, Animethon is presented by the not-for-profit Alberta Society for Asian Popular Arts (ASAPA).A Taste of Animethon was first created in 2010. While nowhere near the size of Animethon itself it's been a successful event in its own right with a steadily growing attendance. In 2013 we moved venues to the Ramada Inn and Conference Centre. In 2016 we moved to the Shaw Conference Centre so we could enjoy a larger venue!Animethonは1994年にBanzai Anime Club of Alberta（BAKA）によって、日本アニメを広めるために始まったイベントです。有名無名のアニメを参加者に供給する中で現在の規模にまで拡大しました。Animethonは非営利の団体、Alberta Society for Asian Popular Arts（ASAPA）によって催されています。A Taste of Animethonは2010年に初めて開催され、本家Animethonよりは小規模ながら、順調に参加者数を伸ばしています。2013年には会場をRamada Inn and Conference Centerに移し、2016年にはさらに大規模なShaw Conference Centerにて開催されました。

Title: Animazement / Animazement
Country: United States of America / United States of America / 米国
Summary: The mission of Animazement is to provide an introduction to Japanese Language and Culture, through the world of Japanese Animation and Manga. For three days each spring, a diverse group of attendees, volunteers, special Japanese and American guests, panelists, and our staff come together to share in celebrating Japanese entertainment and visual culture. Our activities span the various genres of anime, manga, video games, J-pop/J-rock, martial arts, traditional arts and crafts, and more in a family-friendly, festival-like atmosphere. Sure, it’s a party, but it is our sincere hope that everyone who attends Animazement will learn something and leave with a greater sense of cultural understanding and appreciation for Japanese Culture and Language.Animazementのミッションは日本の言語と文化を、アニメや漫画を通じて紹介することです。3日間のイベントの期間中には多様なファン、ボランティア、日本やアメリカからのゲストやパネリスト、そしてスタッフにより日本のエンターテインメントと映像文化を楽しむために集います。イベント内での企画は、アニメ、漫画、ビデオゲームからJ-POP、武芸、伝統工芸など幅広いジャンルをカバーし、家族向きの、お祭りのような雰囲気の中で行われます。このイベントはパーティーであると同時に、参加者が何かを学び、日本の文化理解を深めるための学びの場でもあります。

Title: Anime Boston / Anime Boston
Country: United States of America / United States of America / 米国
Summary: Anime Boston is a three-day convention held annually in Boston, Massachusetts, USA under the supervision of the New England Anime Society. Our focus is to celebrate and promote Japanese animation, comics, and pop-culture.This event has been a cornerstone of the North East Anime Convention circuit since our inaugural event in April, 2003. Following unprecedented growth, we quickly outgrew the space in the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and moved to the Hynes Convention Center in 2005. The Hynes Convention Center and Sheraton Boston have allowed us to grow in ways we could not have imagined since the idea was first conceived.While the main focus on Anime Boston has always been Japanese animation and comics, we have expanded to include other aspects of Japanese pop-culture: J-Pop, J-Rock, and live-action Japanese media. We have also delved into Japanese history and traditional culture, thus encouraging people to develop a more well-rounded perspective.Over 350 staff members work to make this convention possible. On top of that, everyone is a volunteer; no one gets paid for what they do. We all participate because we are also fans (and might be a little crazy). We work year-round to prepare for each convention; in fact, planning for the next year begins before the previous one is even over! Our staff is incredibly diverse and comes from all walks of life and experiences. The hard work and dedication of our staff members ensures that we put on the best show possible.Of course, Anime Boston would not be the success it has become without the support of its members and fans. Starting with a staggering 4,000 members in 2003 (an incredible feat for a brand new convention), by 2012 we had expanded to welcome more than 22,000 people over the weekend. The majority of our panels are actually presented by members who just want to share their passions with the larger community. Having members organize some of the programming for Anime Boston gives everyone a sense of community and belonging at our event.We, the staff of Anime Boston and the New England Anime Society, thank you for taking interest in our convention. Your excitement helps energize everyone and spreads the word to new people. We hope to see you there!Anime Bostonはアメリカのマサチューセッツ州ボストンで、New England Anime Societyの監督のもと毎年行われる三日間に渡るイベントです。我々の目的は日本のアニメ、漫画、ポップカルチャーを楽しみ、盛り上げてゆくことにあります。このイベントは2003年四月の開始以来、北東アメリカのアニメイベントの中で重要な地位を占めてきました。参加人数の大幅な増加と共に、場所をBoston Park Plaza HotelからHynes Convention CenterとSheraton Bostonへ移し、初年度には想像もしなかった規模にまで拡大しました。日本文化と漫画だけでなく、J-PopやJ-Rock、実写メディアを含んだ日本文化全体へジャンルを拡大し、参加者の日本の歴史や伝統文化への包括的理解を促進しています。350人を超えるスタッフは全員がボランティアです。皆がアニメを愛するファンであるがゆえに一年を通してこのイベントの企画に力を注ぎます。翌年のイベントの企画は、その年のイベントが終了してすぐに始まります。スタッフは実に多様な経歴を持っており、最良の企画を実現するために努力しています。もちろん、このイベントはスタッフだけでなくファンのサポートによって成り立っています。2003年には4000人からスタートしたイベントは、2012年には22,000人を超える参加者を記録しました。パネルイベントも、有志のファンによって行われており、一人一人がコミュニティに属しているのだという思いを持ってイベントに参加しています。我々Anime BostonのスタッフとNew England Anime Societyはこのイベントに関心を示してくださる全ての方に感謝してします。皆さんが、また新たな友人をこのイベントに呼んでくださり、より多くの方々とイベントの場で会えることを楽しみにしています。

Title: Anime Central / Anime Central
Country: United States of America / United States of America / 米国
Summary: The Anime Central Event – also known as ACen – is the Largest Anime and Manga Convention in the Midwest.  Anime Central provides a place for fans of Asian and associated American media to gather and celebrate the culture and fandom.  With the goal of creating a safe, unique, and family-friendly environment for all ages and backgrounds, Anime Central uses mediums such as anime, manga, games, music, and cultural exploration as tools to expose its members and the general public to this fandom while adapting to their everchanging culture. Title: Animethon / Animethon
Organizer: Alberta Society for Asian Popular Arts (ASAPA)
Summary: Animethon started back in 1994 by the Banzai Anime Klub of Alberta (BAKA), with the intent of promoting Japanese anime. It became a success by presenting well-known and more obscure anime to audiences, and has since grown to what it is now. Today, Animethon is presented by the not-for-profit Alberta Society for Asian Popular Arts (ASAPA).In the beginning, Animethon was a one-day event that allowed people to view different Japanese Anime movies and television shows within two classrooms at Grant MacEwan. Since Animethon 2, the festival has grown to utilize the entirety of the University campus for events, artist alley, education panels, and a large vendor hall. Title: Otafest / Otafest
Organizer: Otafest Film and Cultural Festrival Planning Committee
Summary: Otafest was born in 1999 when the University of Calgary’s Dedicated Otaku Anime Club decided to have a 1 day film festival showing Japanese Animation (anime) to the public.Over the next decade, Otafest has grown to become a three day festival with approximately 8,000 attendees annually. The festival is run by a non-profit organization (Otafest Film and Cultural Festival Planning Committee), and while we still showcase anime, it is just a part of the festival experience.Otafest is an annual conference for anime enthusiasts. We act as a creative outlet for fans, an occasion where they can show their passion and appreciation of the hobby. We are an event where fans can show off the costumes they have made, the music videos they have created, and the art they have painted and drawn. Otafest is a forum for discussion and education. We host educational panels introducing others to the basics of the Japanese language and tips on how to use computer programs to enhance music videos and CG art. Title: Setsucon / Setsucon
Country: United States of America / United States of America / 米国
Summary: Setsucon is hosted by the Penn State Anime Organization (PSAO). Since September 2001, the PSAO has been bringing anime, manga and Japanese pop culture to the University Park campus. Working to provide both weekly screenings and a social environment for Penn State's anime/manga fan base, the PSAO is continually broadening its horizons. The PSAO meetings serve multiple functions, including our free weekly anime screenings. We also arrange trips to conventions, have club social events, facilitate DDR events on campus, and much much more!Setsucon strives to bring a safe and inclusive social environment to anime and manga fans of all ages across Central Pennsylvania and beyond.  We aim to bring the big convention feel to a more intimate and affordable convention.Founded in 2007, Setsucon started out as a single day convention, headlined by the programming, rather than the guests, with events such as the Masquerade, Setsu Odori (Dance), and our Host Auction, which has become a marquee event and is unique to our convention.  Our Host Auction, which has cosplayers put on a scripted scene, in dressed as characters from games and anime, and then be auctioned off for dessert with an attendee, as their host; this consistently raises a thousand dollars or more for charity.  In 2008, Setsucon expanded to two days, adding even more programming throughout the years, such as our take on iron chef, Iron Cosplay, as well as bringing in many industry guests.  We strive to bring theses joys to our attendees at affordable rates, keeping our pre-registration prices below $25 and at-con prices below $35.Most recently, in 2017, we we had a full slate of events, such as the general Masquerade, Dance, Host Auction, and Iron Cosplay, as well as a comedy show by our guest Karl "Uncle Yo" Custer, a belly dancing show by our guest, Antipode, and panels from both attendees and our voice actor guests, Keith Silverstein, Kira Buckland, and Erica Lindbeck.  We also showed sneak peak clips from the upcoming Skip Beat dub, thanks to Pied Piper.  In addition, we had a large exhibitors hall filled with over 30 vendors and artists, two viewings rooms, and a game room with close to 30 gaming systems.In 2018, we are expanding outside of State College, our former home, and moving to Altoona, PA, to the Blair County Convention Center, to continue to bring all of the big events from a large con to our attendees and still at an afforable rate.Setsuconは、ペンシルバニア州アニメクラブ（PSAO）が主催しているイベントです。2001年9月より、PSAOはアニメ、マンガ、日本のポップカルチャーを普及するため無料のアニメ上映会などのイベントをUniversity Parkキャンパスで毎週開催、コンベンションへのグループ旅行を企画、ファン同士の交流イベント、キャンパスでのDDR大会を開催するなど、意欲的に活動してきました。Setsuconは、ペンシルバニア中央部のあらゆる年代のアニメファンや漫画ファンに、安全で解放的な交流環境を提供するよう努めています。大きなコンベンションを、より親密で身近なものとして参加者に楽しんでもらうことを目指しています。2007年に設立されたSetsuconは、ゲストイベントの代わりにコスプレ大会やセツ・オドリ（ダンス）、今ではSetsucon独自の目玉イベントとなった「ホスト・オークション」などの様々な企画で構成された一日限りのコンベンションとしてスタートしました。ホストオークションは、ゲームやアニメのキャラクターに扮したコスプレイヤーと一緒にデザートを食べる権利を参加者が競り落とすイベントで、毎年千ドル以上の額が集まります。2008年、セツコンは2日間に拡大し、コスプレの鉄人のような企画をさらに充実させ、業界から多数のゲストを招待しました。手頃な料金でイベントの楽しさを提供するために、事前登録価格を25ドル以下、会場価格を35ドル以下に抑えるよう努めています。2017年にはコスプレ大会、ダンス、ホストオークション、コスプレの鉄人などのイベントに加え、ゲストであるKarl Custer（通称Yoおじさん）のコメディショー、Antipodeによるベリーダンス、ゲスト声優であるKeith Silverstein、Kira Buckland、Erica Lindbeckや有志のパネルディスカッションなどが行われました。また、Pied Piperのサポートにより、Skip Beatの吹き替え版のプレミア上映も行うことができました。30社以上の企業やクリエイターによる物販展示、2つのアニメ上映室、約30のゲームを備えたゲームルームも設けられました。2018年には、州立大学の外に会場を移し、ペンシルバニア州アルトゥーナでのイベント開催を予定しております。価格は手頃なものに据え置きつつ、より大きな会場で参加者に楽しい時間を過ごしてもらう予定です。

Title: AnimeShuriken / AnimeShuriken
Summary: AnimeShuriken is a festival that lasts one to two days. It happens once a year when conditions are created and are ready to make the event a good influx of staff. Usually in July or August vacation. It is the oldest in Cuba and is organized for anyone who likes anime, manga or general culture of Japan. AnimeShuriken program also includes rooms with video projections, Expo selling action figures, doujinshis exhibitions, exhibitions and comepetencias cosplay, Anime Music Video, video games, karaoke, among others. We played extremely important issues of Japanese culture. traditional martial arts, calligraphy, kimonos and yukata test, exhibition of Japanese arms both samurai and  shinobi. Tea ceremony, bonsai trees, etc. Including the invitation of Japanese residing in Cuba or the Embassy of Japan to many of our activities. Including historical presentations as the Battle of Sekigahara each year; where models, video games are presented, among others.Anime Shurikenは1日、もしくは2日間開催されます。イベントは開催準備の状況やイベントスタッフの運営準備によって開催有無、日程が決定されます。通常は7月または8月の休日に開催します。日本のアニメ、マンガ、一般文化が好きな人に向けたキューバで一番古いイベントです。 Anime Shurikenプログラムは、ビデオ投影、アクションフィギュアの販売、同人誌の展示、展覧会、コスプレ、アニメミュージックビデオの上映、ビデオゲーム、カラオケなどで構成されています。私たちは書道、着物と浴衣の試着、武士と忍の武器展示、茶道、盆栽の木など歴史ある日本文化の紹介を行いました。日本の大使館や日本のキューバ在住の日本人の招待し、私たちの活動を見てもらいました。

Title: Convenção de Animes e Tokusatsus de Uberlândia CATSU / Convencao de Animes e Tokusatsus de Uberlandia CATSU
Summary: CATSU is is an annually held, two-day pop culture convention, based on japanese animation. It's hosted by Classe S Produções. CATSU was held for the first time in October 2008 in Uberlândia. The convention includes not only japanese animation, but also video games, cosplay, workshops, board games, shop areas, concerts, special guests and numerous competitions envolving the culture. The convention discloses the boundless universe of Japanese popular culture through the values transmitted to people by providing them with leisure, entertainment and knowledge, creating awareness of the importance of socialization, respect and brotherhood among people with interactive activities preserving core values: respect, unity and working together.CATSUは毎年2回開かれる、アニメを中心としたポップカルチャーのイベントです。主催はClass S Produçõesで、2008年10月にブラジルのUberlândiaでスタートしました。アニメに加えビデオゲームやコスプレを取り扱い、ワークショップやボードゲーム、物販エリアにコンサート、ゲストイベントや様々なコンテストの企画があります。参加者に娯楽やエンタメ、さらには知識を提供し、参加型企画で人々が互いに交流し敬愛や友情の大切さを感じることができるこのイベントは、日本のポップカルチャーの核となる、他者の尊敬、和、チームワークイベントという価値観を伝え、日本文化が国境にとらわれない普遍的な価値を有していることを示すものとなっています。

Title: J'Fest / J'Fest
Summary: J'Fest® Expo is the festival that has marked a new twist in the entertainment industry of Asia in Mexico : fashion, music and Japanese popular culture ae the main content of this event.The festival brings together stands, art exhibitions, several music venues, themed areas, conferences, workshops, and activities for two days in the season of Spring in the city of Mexico. What make us different is our focus to Japanese music and fashion, instead on having just anime and manga like most events in the region.  We divide the event in 3 main themed floors / areas : “Shibuya”, for Japanese fashion  and J'Rock genre, and “Akihabara”, for J'Pop and anime. Summary: The AniMaCo is a anime and manga convention every two years in Berlin held between end of october and early november which premiered in 2004. The 8th AniMaCo was held last year from the 28th until 30th of october. With 10.000 visitors, that is the same amount as two years ago. More visitors are not possible due to security reasons at our current location. However there are alternative venues which offer bigger visitor capacities we currently cannot afford yet. The focus of the AniMaCo is on the stage program which is rich in variety unlike other conventions in Germany. For example in 2016 about 20 different show-acts performed on stage. Since 2012 we are live streaming out main hall to the internet. In 2014 this has been expanded further to being semi-professional. The stream quality is like TV and Germany wide we are the only convention which streams all of it’s stage performances live on the internet. We plan to improve the quality and extent of content even more in the future. This is to include other parts of the AniMaCo to be streamed as well. Furthermore every day cosplay and game contests are being held where visitors are actively being  involved. On top of that the AniMaCo offers a huge amount of workshops where creativity is at their center. In 2016 we had workshops for like Origami (paper folding, Japanese for beginners, cosplay photography and many more. Title: AnimeCon / AnimeCon
Summary: Animecon is an annual event in The Hague, The Netherlands.  Our aim is not to make a profit or to be the largest possible event. Our aim is to bring our customers the best possible event for their money. We aim to be a big family for everyone in Europe and beyond, which is why our event has always been hosted in English. Because our customers expect it, we offer over 150 different events within the 50 continuous hours AnimeCon runs. Of course we offer a large sales space, free of fake goods. Licensed video programming in HD or 2K, Oricon #1 ranking musicians like Altima, M.O.V.E, BACK-ON, KOTOKO etc. We hold Dutch preliminaries for all important international cosplay events and will, in 2017 expand our own Clara Cow's Cosplay Cup (C4) to 17 competing countries. AnimeCon is not just for kids. Adults can relax in our 24hour Izakaya or can join one of our exclusive Japanese Whisky tastings. We also hold a Nihonshu tasting with award wining brands like Nabeshima from Saga and Otokoyama from Asahikawa.Animeconはオランダのハーグで毎年開催されているイベントです。Animeconの目的は、利益を出すことでも参加者数を増やすことでもなく、参加者満足度の高いイベントであることです。Animeconはヨーロッパ全体のファンが家族のように集う場でありたいとの思いから英語で開催されています。Animeconは50時間連続で催され、その間に150もの企画が行われます。物販エリアでは海賊版を排し、ライセンス許諾をとった作品の上映会を行っています。オリコンで一位をとったAltima, M.O.V.E, BACK-ON, KOTOKOなどのアーティストのライブの他、世界コスプレサミットのオランダ予選も開かれます。2017年には、これに加えて、Animecon主催のClara Cow’s Cosplay Cup（C4）を、17参加カ国で開催します。Animeconは子供だけでなく大人も楽しめるよう、24時間営業の居酒屋を設け、佐賀の鍋島や旭川の男山などの名だたる日本酒の試飲会も開いています。

Title: AniNite / AniNite
Country: Austria / Austria / オーストリア
Summary: AniNite is the biggest fan-convention on Japanese pop culture in Austria, which is hosted annually by the association AniManga. Everything began in 2001, when a few friends decided to turn their Japanese movie and video game nights into a bigger event for more people to enjoy. For the first event about 70 people came together to watch movies and Anime and play video games – the AniNite was born!The following year not only the number of visitors doubled, but a second movie room was rent.2003 the first “Austrian Otaku of the Year” competition took place and even more enthusiasts came to appreciate the event and meet like-minded people. Since then AniNite came a long way and has since tried to build bridges between cultures and religions in a simple mission of uniting fans and giving them a platform. AniNiteは、オーストリアにおいて最も大きな日本のポップカルチャーファンのコンベンションイベントで、AniMangaにより運営されており毎年開催されています。全ては2001年に始まりました、数人の有志が、日本映画やビデオゲームを楽しむ夜を、より大きなイベントに発展させてより多くの人びとが楽しめるようにしようと決めたのです。最初のイベントでは、約70名の人が訪れ、映画やアニメを一緒に見たりテレビゲームで遊んだりしました…AniNiteの誕生です！その後は、参加者が毎回倍以上増えていっただけでなく、部屋の規模も拡大していきました。2003年には、最初の”今年のオーストリアオタク大賞”コンテストが開催され、より多くのファンたちがイベントに参加し、同好の士と会うことができるこのイベントを好きになっていきました。あれ以来、AniNiteは今日にいたるまで長い道をたどってきましたが、異なる文化そして異なる信仰の間に端をかけるという、シンプルなミッションに、ファンを集めて彼らにプラットフォームを提供することにより、挑戦し続けてきました。

Title: Asia Breeze / Asia Breeze
Summary: Since 2004 "Hakuryu" (White dragon) organize interrigional festivals of modern visual culture "AsiaBreeze". This project is important for young people from Ural, Siberia and central part of Russia.  The main targets are: promoting of modern mass visual culture and world culture values; promotion of a healthy lifestyle; interest and employment of youth with different hobbies. Title: ChibiCon / ChibiCon
Summary: ChibiCon is the annual three-day convention dedicated to Japanese pop-culture: anime, manga, video games, music, fashion, cosplay and otaku culture. It is held every winter in Belgrade, Serbia, and it is the largest local event focused exclusively on Japan. It is organized by Sakurabana, a non-profit NGO whose mission is to promote pop-culture and geekery and Serbia. It was first held in 2012, and since then it keeps growing, with more and more visitors each year. The program of ChibiCon includes panels on Japanese pop-culture (on various relevant topics), workshops (on Japanese language, manga drawing, cosplay making, origami, Japanese food cooking, etc.), and competitions (quizzes, public debates, video game tournaments, Anime Music Video, manga fan art and original art, cosplay). Title: DoKomi / DoKomi
Summary: The DoKomi is an anime convention with around 30,000 visitors over two days. Besides focusing on the topics of modern japanese culture like Anime, Manga, Cosplay and Games, DoKomi also includes various traditional aspects such as workshops and performances. Some of the highlights are Germanys first Maid Café “Lucky Chocolate”, the unique Host Club “Sweet Spice” and an exclusive Cosplay Ball among lot’s of other activities. As you can see, DoKomi trys to improve a bit each year and to offer innovative concepts to ensure it’s visitors having fun. We offer a platform for several kinds of japan related exhibitors. Among classical merchandise dealers and publishers we feature space for the areas of games, J-music, tourism, education, as well as private artists, fanprojects and fashion designers. To protect our visitors from being ripped of, we carry out a strict anti-bootleg-policy. Therefore, all kinds of unlicensed products are forbidden to be sold at our event. On the other hand we support honest exhibitors and talented artists in any possible way. For bargains and fortunate deals, cheack out our Bring & Buy! A place to bring your own stuff and we’ll sell it for you. On the other hand you can spend the money directly on convenient second hand mangas, merchandise and more. A great way to finance your convention trip!We offer various showacts and bands a platform on our main stage. Enjoy astonishing performances and entertaining contests, like our pre-eliminary rounds for the national cosplay championship and Eurocosplay. One of the main stage highlights is our character auction for a good cause. Auction yourself as a cosplayer, bishonen or bishojo and get to know nice people while supporting a charitable project. This year we will feature an additional interactive cosplay stage, where you and your friends can become your own star. Entertain the crowd with funny gigs and awesome shows! Title: HIGAN / HIGAN
Summary: Festival "Higan" became the first Belarusian festival, which united all fans of Japanese culture in 2006. From then and now Higan is organized by fans for fans. "Higan" is Japanese for "Equinox", the astronomical event when day and night are equal, and allegorically — change of traditional and modern cultures.The concept of the Festival is to give young people the opportunity to realize themselves and develop their creative potential. Nowadays the festival activity aimed to a deeper familiarity with modern spectator (popular) culture in Japan and East Asia.Higan is annually held, usually 2-day event. Main part is focused on scene programm (13-15 hours with breaks) which consist of different kind of cosplay and theatrical performances, dance and karaoke covers, AMV)The other activity is held in the hall - exhibitions (fanart, photocosplay, craft, ball-jointed dolls); playground area (console games, card games, VR games); market with fan and cosplay stuff and accessories. Title: Hinode Power Japan / Hinode Power Japan
Venue: Exhibition of Achievements of National Economy (VNDKh)
Summary: Hinode Power Japan is the main festival of Japanese culture in Russia, which is annually held in April in Moscow. Hinode Power Japan begun as a cosplay-focused festival in 2012. Now it is one of the few festivals representing both popular modern and traditional Japanese cultures. The program of the festival includes stage performances and autograph sessions of Japanese artists, workshops (manga drawning, sumi-e ink painting, making of onigiri, etc) and master classes ( Japanese folk dances, sumo, etc.), exhibitions (manga, ikebana, etc.), market, Japanese table top games, food court. The diversity and originality of thematic content and its focus on the widest audience allows the festival to remain a truly unique event, interesting for visitors of all ages. Traditionally, within the framework of the festival there are several competitive nominations in various cosplay genres, the main one of which is the Russian qualifying round of the World Cosplay Summit. Hinode Power Japan Organizing Committee sends winners of Russian finals to Japan to represent Russia in this prestigious competition. HINODE POWER JAPANでは、ステージパフォーマンスや日本からのゲストのサイン会、漫画や水墨画の描き方、おにぎりの作り方などの多様なワークショップ、そしてより本格的な日本舞踊や相撲のレッスン、漫画や生け花の展示、物販、日本の卓上ゲームコーナー、フードコートなどの企画があります。取り扱うコンテンツの多様性と独自性、そして老若男女様々な参加者が訪れる点で、Hinode Power Japanは実に特別なイベントとなっています。世界コスプレサミットのロシア予選を含め、様々なジャンルのコスプレのコンテストがこのイベント内で行われています。チャンピオンとなったコスプレイヤーは、ロシア代表として日本で開かれる世界コスプレサミット本戦へ派遣されます。

Title: Japan Weekend Madrid / Japan Weekend Madrid
Summary: The Japan Weekend Madrid is a two-days convention, held twice a year, organised by Jointo Entertainment S.L. It is at this moment the biggest japanese culture event held in Madrid. The first edition happened in 2008. The program of Japan Weekend includes free-play and videogame tournaments, commercial zone, artists alley, scenario for concerts and shows, international cosplay events, conferences by japanese guests… Also, we have many workshops during the weekend: origami, go, cosplay, table games, how to draw manga, calligraphy… In our last edition, we had Mr. Kawamoto and Mr. Oyabu from Studio BONES. In past editions, we brought to Spain guests as mangaka Toshio Maeda, producer Yasuhiro Irie, mangaka Kenji Oiwa, Hideaki Kobayashi (Growhairism)… Japan Weekend Madridは年二回、Jointo Entertainment S.L.によって開かれる2日間のイベントです。現在マドリード最大の日本文化のイベントであるJapan Weekend Madridは、2008年に第1回が開かれました。Japan Weekendではフリープレイやビデオゲームの大会が開かれ、商業ブースや同人ブース、舞台演劇やコンサート、国際的なコスプレコンテスト、日本からのゲストセッションなども催されます。また、週末には折り紙や囲碁、コスプレ、テーブルゲーム、漫画の描き方や習字などの多数のワークショップが開かれます。前回開催時には、スタジオボンズのアニメーター川元さんとプロデューサー大藪さんを招き、それ以前には漫画家の前田俊夫さんやプロデューサーの入江康浩さん、漫画家大岩ケンヂさん、セーラー服おじさんとして知られる小林秀章さんらをゲストとして招待しました。

Title: JapAniManga Night / JapAniManga Night
Summary: JapAniManga Night is an extensive yearly happening around Japanese culture in Davos, which attracts Japan enthusiasts from all over the country and aims to entertain the whole family.For more than 15 years, as an inclusive sociocultural event, it has offered a place to interact, explore and have fun. It provides a comprehensive insight into Japan and its culture, brings together like-minded people and makes a commitment to fostering mutual understanding and respect between Swiss and Japanese, whether young or old.The range of activities spans from movie screenings to an outdoor matsuri, from business conferences to rock concerts and from cultural workshops to a rave party.JapAniManga Nightは、ダボスにて毎年開催される日本文化について取扱う、世界中の日本文化のファンを魅了し全ての世代を楽しませるイベントです。JapAniManga Nightは、広範囲の内容を取り扱う社会文化的なイベントとして、15年以上にわたり探究心にみちあふれた、楽しい場を提供し続けています。日本文化の包括的な洞察を提供し、スイスと日本の相互理解と相互尊重を年齢に関わらず促進させ、同好の士が出会う機会を提供します。JapAniManga Nightのアクティビティ内容は、映画上映から会場外での祭り、ビジネス会議やロックコンサート、文化的なワークショップやレイヴパーティーまで、幅広くコンテンツがそろってます。

Title: MondoCon / MondoCon
Summary: MondoCon is the biggest geek convention in Hungary (perhaps the biggest in the region) which we organize each Spring, Summer and Autumn – each convention being one weekend long.On a busy day we have more than 10,000 visitors and we place a lot of emphasis on community building. We take pride in the fact that our convention is known for its friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The first MondoCon was held in 2008 and back then it was a manga/anime convention. We remained true to our roots and manga/anime fandom is still one of the cornerstones of our events. But if you are not interested in that, don’t worry! Over the years our convention embraced all things geek! We have cartoons, fantasy, scifi and tv show fandoms all covered, and a large section dedicated to videogames and esports as well. And we must mention cosplay, because it is quite a big thing at MondoCon. Around a third of our visitors arrive in some sort of cosplay: from simple nekomimi and naruto-headbands to award-winning masterpieces, you will see a thousand different cosplays.Our conventions have an undiminished popularity so we decided to open up to international visitors. Title: Pandakon Croatia / Pandakon Croatia
Summary: Pandakon Croatiaは毎年開かれる二日間のアニメイベントです。クロアチア最大のアニメ、アジア文化のイベントで、もともとコスプレイヤーの集会としてスタートしましたが、今はより幅広い分野を扱うコンベンションの形で、ファンによりファンのために催されています。2012年の第一回は一日のみの開催でしたが、第二回からは二日間開かれるようになり、2015年以降はクロアチアのザグレブで毎年九月に開催されています。Pandakonは主に日本とそのアニメ・漫画・伝統文化を中心としたコンベンションですが、年々中国や韓国などより幅広いアジア圏の文化も扱うようになっています。開催企画は大きく二つ：映像文化企画と伝統文化企画に分けられ、前者では上映会やビデオゲーム、コスプレ大会、クイズやカラオケ、ダンスイベントなどが行われます。一方後者では日本の歴史や文化についての講義、習字や折り紙のワークショップ、武道の実演や体験会が催されます。 Pandakonはまた、バルカン地域での類似のイベント主催団体との友好関係構築にも積極的で、過去にはスロベニアやセルビアのイベント主催者をゲストとして招待しており、今後はハンガリーのイベントとも関係を強化してゆきたいと考えています。Pandakon Croatia is held every year, as a two-day convention. It is the largest anime or thematically Asian-oriented convention in Croatia. It started as an idea about a cosplay meet up and then slowly was turned into a convention. It is run by fans for fans.The first edition was in 2012., held as a one day event, but every year after that it was a two day event. Since 2015., it is held every year in September, in Zagreb, Croatia.Pandakon is as a convention largely about representing Japan and its anime and manga interests and Japanese culture, but each year we try to add things about other Asian countries, such as China and Korea. The program is divided into two main parts: the audiovisual program and the traditional program. The audiovisual part has projections, video gaming part, cosplay competition, quizzes, karaoke, Just Dance and such. The traditional part of the program is lectures about the history or certain parts of the culture, calligraphy workshops, origami workshops, martial arts demonstrations and other interactive program parts.  Pandakon also tries to have bring about or create good relations with similar organizations in the region, and in doing so, had our colleagues from Slovenia and Serbia as guests or part of the program, with hopes to do the same with our Hungary colleagues.

Summary: SFeraKon is an annually held, three-day speculative fiction convention organized by SFera society from Zagreb, Croatia. While it started as a literary convention for sci-fi, fantasy and horror genre, it outgrew its roots and spread to encompass much of the local fandom. Now it's a place for fans of boardgames, books, movies, cosplay, anime, comics and all other forms of speculative fiction and what is now known as "geeky subculture".SFeraKon began in 1978 as the first convention of that type in this region and it still remains the largest sci-fi con in Croatia, bringing in almost 2000 visitors every year. With guests from abroad and multilingual lecturers, there is a good number of program items held in English and something for every age group to enjoy. SFeraKon boasts with regularly having more than 130 items during these three days including lectures, panels, quizzes, games, workshops and so much more. Title: AFA Indonesia / AFA Indonesia
Country: Indonesia / Indonesia / インドネシア
Summary: Covering Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia, Over 14 festivals held in Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia, the festival has established an attendance of over 220 thousand across South East Asia in 2015.  Centred around Japanese animation, and ranging from comics, figurines, food culture, fashion to hardware, the festival continues to introduce new and trending Japanese popular culture. The festival enjoys high attendance due to it’s practice of listening to the fans - and consistently delivering world class content to them.  This creates the perfect environment for J-Culture related brands, products and services to thrive.  Supporting this, will also be business matching opportunities, and test marketing to determine the feasibility of new products and services to a highly savvy and responsive audience of young and discerning adults.The event consists of 3 central pillars: the ""Exhibition Area"" consisting of merchandise booths, the ""Stage (day)"" featuring various contents such as cosplay, guest appearances, screenings of newest anime etc. as well as the ""Concert (night)"", South East Asia's largest gathering of J-POP artiste live performances.AFA serves as a bridge for Japanese content owners seeking to expand commercially into South East Asia by providing multi-country platforms to increase exposure of their brands. This multi-country exposure is unique to AFA.2015年、シンガポール、インドネシア、タイ、そしてマレーシアで行われる14回以上のイベントを通じて、AFAは東南アジアで220,000人を超える合計集客数を誇るイベントになりました。日本アニメを中心に、漫画やフィギュア、食文化、ファッションからハードウェア製品まで、AFAは日本の最先端のポップカルチャーを東南アジアの人々へ紹介し続けています。AFAはファンの声をよく聞き、良質なコンテンツを擁していることから、多くの参加者を魅了しています。日本文化にまつわるブランドや製品、サービスを展開するのに最高の環境です。商談や、良識ある若い参加者たちに対するテストマーケティングの場としても活用していただけます。イベントは物販を行う展示ブースと、コスプレやゲスト講演、新作アニメの上映会などが行われるステージ、それから東南アジア最大規模のJPOPアーティストのライブが行われるコンサートの三つの企画によって構成されています。AFAは日本のコンテンツ所有者が東南アジアでビジネス的成功を収めるための複数国家にわたるプラットフォームとして機能し、ブランドの広報活動にも役立っています。

Title: Ani-Com & Games Hong Kong / Ani-Com & Games Hong Kong
Country: Hong Kong / Hong Kong / 香港
Summary: Ani-Com & Games Hong Kong (ACGHK) is the most popular summer carnival in Hong Kong for the younger generation. It is packed with the best selection of animation, comics, games, toys, special edition collectibles, and a variety of hit-hot activities, including the Asian Pacific Cosplay Carnival, Cosplay Contest, live performance of anime theme songs and etc to keep spirits high. The international status, professional standards of operation, the variety of events and wide range of ground-breaking products have built ACGHK as one of the most prominent expos of its kind in the Greater China Region. Every year it attracts a large number of governmental organizations and commercial corporations from China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Europe and the Americas to seek out new ventures and opportunities.Inspired by Comic Market and its achievements in promoting doujinshi culture, ACGHK started to organize Creative Paradise concurrently with the expo since 2014. Creative Paradise shares the same ideals and vision as Comiket and aims at building Creative Paradise one of the most influential marketplace for creativity to flourish.Ani-Com&Games Hong Kong (ACGHK)は香港の若年層にとって最も人気のある夏の祭典です。厳選されたアニメ、漫画、ゲーム、玩具、コレクター商品が一堂に会し、アジア太平洋コスプレカーニバルやコスプレコンテスト、アニメソングのライブ演奏などの様々なイベントが催され、参加者を楽しませます。 その国際的な地位、洗練されたオペレーション、そして幅広いイベント企画と取り扱う商品の多様性により、ACGHKは広域中華圏における最も有名なアニメイベントの一つとなっています。ACGHKへは毎年中国、日本、韓国、台湾、そして欧米から、たくさんの政府系機関や企業団体が、新たなビジネス機会と可能性を求めて訪れます。 日本のコミックマーケットとその同人文化に触発され、ACGHKは2014年より、Creative Paradiseを同時開催するようになりました。これはコミックマーケットと同様の理念に基づき、人々の創造活動を育む場となることを目指すイベントです。

Title: Animangaki / Animangaki
Summary: AniManGaki, one of the largest convention of its kind in Malaysia, is the brainchild of Sunway University Anime Club (SUAC)'s founder, Yvonne Sing Yee Wen. The annual convention is formed by fans, for fans; with the sole purpose of bringing together animation, comics, and gaming enthusiasts from all walks of life. Branded as "The Trendsetter", AniManGaki continues to surprise visitors by bringing new content to the event each year.Since 2012, AniManGaki had finalized its separation from Sunway University, becoming a convention solely organized by the AniManGaki Organizing Committee, presently under Rakugaki Events PLT. Its founding members continue to actively participate in major event operations till today. Title: Asia Pop Comicon / Asia Pop Comicon
Summary: AsiaPOP Comicon (APCC) will be an international pop culture convention themed around comics, film, toys and collectibles, animation, games, cosplay, superheroes and everything pop culture. The event will attract several internationally renowned artists, celebrities and pop-culture icons to various pockets of Asia, starting with Manila in the Philippines, and draw the attention of ardent fans. APCC will feature exhibitors from genres of pop culture and top studios from the across the globe, to bring popular brands and exclusive content for the show.Focusing on delivering the ultimate fan experience, APCC aspires to bring geek culture mainstream and stand tall as a perfect launch pad to unveil new products and first look of movies for the Asia Pacific region providing a galore of potential opportunities for SMEs in the entertainment business to reach out to big brands and the vibrant creative talent pool from APAC. Started in 2002, this annual December event has grown steadily into a massive gathering of tens of thousands of fans consisting of comic artists, illustrators, cosplayers, vendors, performers, and more!Held over 2 days, its staple highlights include one of the biggest gatherings of artist booths in the region, a variety of exhibitors and vendors, a massive stage featuring both local and international performers, as well as competitions, talks, and food for its attendees to partake.For more information on the event, check out their FB page @ facebook.com/ComicFiesta.コミックフィエスタは、東南アジアで最大かつ最長のアニメーション、コミック、ゲーム（ACG）イベントのひとつです。 2002年に始まり、毎年12月に行われるこちらのイベントは、漫画家、イラストレーター、コスプレイヤー、物販、パフォーマーなど数万人が集まり、着実に成長しています。2日にわたって開催されるこちらのイベント。その最大の特長は、参加サークルが地域最大級で、企業の展示ブースも充実しています。また国内外のパフォーマーによる華やかなステージや競技会、トークショーも開催されます。イベントの詳細については、FBページ@ facebook.com/ComicFiestaをご覧ください。

Title: Comic Frontier / Comic Frontier
Country: Indonesia / Indonesia / インドネシア
Summary: Comic Frontier or known as COMIFURO is a Doujinshi convention inspired from Japan's Comic Market, that held twice a year in Jakarta, Indonesia. Comic Frontier aims local creators and artists who have interest -especially although not limited- in anime, manga and game to express and promote their works directly to the public and fans. Title: Doujin Market - Doujima / Doujin Market - Doujima
Country: Singapore / Singapore / シンガポール
Summary: Doujin Market – Doujima is Singapore's largest community curated doujin arts and illustration market. It celebrates both derivative fan art and also original content created by artists and circles in Singapore and the region. This event brings together talents producing pop culture inspired and original handicrafts, digital and traditional art, multimedia, music and visual novels, as well as regional fans, educators and stakeholders. Each year, renowned creatives from the arts industry are invited to grace the event, to share their experiences and to hold workshops to help arts enthusiasts and youth talents improve in their chosen fields. The event also serves as a marketplace for ideas and talent, providing companies and aspiring creators opportunities to connect with each other.Doujin Market 、通称 Doujimaは、シンガポール最大のコミュニティである同人誌のイラストレーションマーケットです。 シンガポールとその周辺地域のアーティストやサークルが作成した二次創作作品とオリジナルコンテンツの両方を扱っています。 このイベントでは、地域の一般参加者だけでなく、ポップカルチャーやオリジナルの手工芸品、デジタルや伝統芸術、マルチメディア、音楽、ビジュアル小説など各分野における才能あるアーティストが集まります。 毎年、芸術産業界で有名なクリエイターがイベントに招待され、芸術愛好家や若者の才能が開花するようなワークショップが開催されます。 このイベントは、アイデアや才能を売り込む市場としても機能し、熱心なクリエイターと企業をマッチングさせるための機会を提供しています。

Title: Fancy Frontier / Fancy Frontier
Organizer: Taiwan Animation and Comic Promoting Association
Venue: Yuanshan Park Area of Taipei Expo Park
Summary: 「Fancy Frontier開拓動漫祭」は2002年10月から開催し、「コミケのように賑やかで、生命力や創造力が溢れる」という趣旨を目指す漫画及びアニメのイベントです。台湾におけるアニメ、マンガ、同人創作関連のイベントの中に、最も規模が大きいイベントになっております。そのほかのオンリーイベントでも、数千人から一万人近くの来場者数を有します。日本のアニメ、マンガ、ゲーム企業や諸外国の関連産業が台湾で宣伝とマーケッティングを行う海外イベントの場になっております。イベント内容については、もちろん同人誌即売会とサークルの交流の場を中心とするが、同時に台湾、日本、香港の企業も一緒に参加します。ステージにミニライブ、声優イベント、作家の座談会やコスプレコンテストなどが催します。会場内は即売会がメインになっておりますので、一般参加者のコスプレは会場の外側で行います。痛車の展示は、それぞれの会場の規定に従い、指定された駐車場に展示します。「Fancy　Frontier」はイベント主催企業として、様々の交流の場を設けなければならないと感じます。「海外」と言えば、もちろん文化交流は重要で、創作者に対しては、将来商業ビジネスと繋がる機会を促進したいし、ファンに対しては、イベントを参加する時の楽しさを存分愉しませたいと存じて、一般人やメディアに対して私どもをもっと理解させたい責任があり、外部にアニメ、マンガの世界にもっとプラス的に向き合いたいと存じます。
